definition: established by popular usage (idiom); common usage agreement/customary convention
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Here refers to the meaning of grain first refers to the established traditional meaning.
sentences.chinese: 這裏所指紋飾的含義首要是指約定俗成的傳統含義。

sentences.english: Taboo is a custom of prohibition as considering holiness or unholiness of something.
sentences.chinese: 禁忌是關於神聖或不潔的約定俗成的一種禁制。

sentences.english: Wearing a coat and tie is an accepted convention on such an occasion.
sentences.chinese: 在那種場合，穿外套系領帶是約定俗成的穿着要求。

sentences.english: Property is natural in one sense but conventional in another.
sentences.chinese: 財產既是自然權利，但也有約定俗成的一面。

sentences.english: There are proscribed "right" and "wrong" ways to behave when using an elevator.
sentences.chinese: 使用電梯時，有約定俗成的正確的和錯誤的行爲。

definition: to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
